Class PileBase

java.lang.Object
edu.wit.scds.ds.lists.app.card_game.universal_base.pile.PileBase
All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterable<CardBase>
Direct Known Subclasses:
Pile
public abstract class PileBase extends Object implements Iterable<CardBase>
Representation of a pile of cards

the top card is at position 0

Version:
1.0 2021-12-08 Initial implementation, 2.0 2025-03-26
  • change to abstract class so games must be built with appropriate subclasses of Pile
  • remove no-arg constructor
, 3.0 2025-03-30
  • switch from ArrayList to LinkedList to improve efficiency to add/remove at both ends of the list (top and bottom) with O(1) efficiency
  • remove initial capacity argument from constructor - no longer needed/relevant
  • major cleanup and restructuring
  • move shuffle() here from Deck
  • support iteration
, 4.0 2025-06-26
  • track changes to other classes to support different types of card decks
  • move standard playing deck-specific methods to Pile
  • add various constructors and methods
  • make most instance methods fluent
, 5.0 2025-07-12
  • rename from Pile to UniversalBasePile for consistency with Card
  • add null-argument checking
  • add methods to manipulate the default orientation
  • support AS-IS default orientation
  • rename some methods to improve consistency
  • add tooling to optionally restrict cards based upon their persistence
, 6.0 2025-11-02 rename from UniversalBasePile to PileBase - less of a mouthful, 6.1 2025-11-19
  • add template card support
  • prevent clearing a pile unless it only contains temporary cards
, 6.2 2025-11-19 add support for verification of decks that they have the correct contents, typically at the end of a game to determine if any cards have been lost
Author:
Dave Rosenberg

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    private Persistence
    acceptablePersistence
    restrict to permanent, template, temporary, or accept any - can only be set during instantiation
    protected List<CardBase>
    cards
    the list of cards where the top is in position 0 and the bottom is the highest position
    protected static final Persistence
    DEFAULT_ACCEPTABLE_CARD_PERSISTENCE
    by default, piles will only accept permanent cards
    protected static final Orientation
    DEFAULT_ORIENTATION
    by default, leave the orientation for Cards added to us unchanged
    protected Orientation
    defaultOrientation
    indicate whether added cards should be face up or down or left as-is by default

      by default, piles will only accept permanent cards

      indicate whether added cards should be face up or down or left as-is by default

    • PileBase

      protected PileBase(Orientation initialOrientation)
      Initialize the pile with added cards placed face up/down/as-is by default
      Parameters:
      initialOrientation - specify the default orientation for newly added cards
      Since:
      3.0

    • PileBase

      protected PileBase(Persistence persistenceSetting)
      initialize this pile with added cards required to be compatible with the specified persistence
      Parameters:
      persistenceSetting - specify whether this pile will only accept permanent, template, temporary, or any cards
      Since:
      3.0

    • PileBase

      protected PileBase(PileBase sourcePile)
      initialize the pile and populate it with provide Cards
      Parameters:
      sourcePile - if non-null, any Cards it contains will be moved to this Pile
      Since:
      4.0

    • PileBase

      protected PileBase(PileBase sourcePile, Orientation initialOrientation)
      initialize the pile and populate it with provided Cards
      Parameters:
      sourcePile - if non-null, any Cards it contains will be moved to this Pile
      initialOrientation - specify whether cards will be face up or down by default
      Since:
      4.0

  • Method Details

    • addAtPosition

      public PileBase addAtPosition(CardBase newCard, int position) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
      Add a single card at a specified position
      Parameters:
      newCard - the card to add - will be turned face up/down if necessary
      position - the 0-based position for the card where 0 is the top
      Returns:
      this pile (fluent)
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the position is invalid given the current card count
      Since:
      3.0

    • addToBottom

      Returns:
      this pile (fluent)
      Since:
      3.0

      Returns:
      the current number of cards in the pile

    • clear

      public PileBase clear()
      remove all cards from the pile

      use with caution - all cards must eventually be returned to the deck(s)

      Returns:
      this pile (fluent)
      Since:
      3.0

    • flipAll

      public PileBase flipAll()
      flip all cards in the pile - if a card was face down, turn it face up, and vice versa
      Returns:
      this pile (fluent)

      public Persistence getAcceptablePersistence()
      retrieve the persistence restrictions for this pile

      Returns:
      the default orientation
      Since:

    • getBottomCard

      public CardBase getBottomCard() throws NoCardsException
      Retrieve the bottom card from the pile - the card is not removed from the pile

      Caution: the returned card should only be in one pile at any time

      Returns:
      the bottom card
      Throws:
      NoCardsException - if the pile is empty
      Since:
      3.0

    • getCardAt

      public CardBase getCardAt(int position) throws NoCardsException
      Retrieve a specific card from the pile by position - the card is not removed from the pile

      Caution: the returned card should only be in one pile at any time

      Parameters:
      position - the 0-based position of the card in the pile where 0 is the top of the pile
      Returns:
      the specified card
      Throws:
      NoCardsException - if the pile is empty
      Since:
      3.0

    • getCardLike

      public CardBase getCardLike(CardBase likeCard)
      Retrieve a specific card from the pile by card - the card is not removed from the pile

      Caution: the returned card should only be in one pile at any time

      Parameters:
      likeCard - a placeholder - usually is a throw-away instance used for lookup only, not game play
      Returns:
      the specified card or null if the card isn't in the pile
      Since:
      3.0

    • getTopCard

      public CardBase getTopCard() throws NoCardsException
      Retrieve the top card from the pile - the card is not removed from the pile

      Caution: the returned card should only be in one pile at any time

      Note: there is no corresponding convenience method to retrieve the bottom card since that's usually cheating and we can't condone that 8~)

      Returns:
      the top card
      Throws:
      NoCardsException - if the pile is empty
      Since:
      3.0

    • hideAll

      public PileBase hideAll()
      turn all cards in the pile face down
      Returns:
      this pile (fluent)

    • matchCount

      public int matchCount(CardBase targetCard)
      Counts the number of cards in the pile which match the target card

      This count may be different than would be determined by testing cards for equality, for instance, if matching only rank or suit.

      Parameters:
      targetCard - the card to look for
      Returns:
      the number of cards which match the target card

    • moveCardsToBottom

      public PileBase moveCardsToBottom(PileBase otherCards)
      Move all cards from otherCards to the bottom of this pile
      Parameters:
      otherCards - another pile of cards

      post-condition: otherCards will be empty

      Returns:
      this pile (fluent)

    • moveCardsToTop

      public PileBase moveCardsToTop(PileBase otherCards)
      Move all cards from otherCards to the top of this pile

      otherCards are placed in their original order on top of the current top of this pile

      Parameters:
      otherCards - another pile of cards

      post-condition: otherCards will be empty

      Returns:
      this pile (fluent)

      Remove all instances of a specific card from the pile
      Parameters:
      lookupCard - the card to be removed
      removedCards - an existing PileBase to receive the removed cards
      Returns:
      this pile (fluent)
      Since:

    • removeCardAt

      public CardBase removeCardAt(int position) throws NoCardsException, IndexOutOfBoundsException
      Remove a specific card from the pile by position
      Parameters:
      position - the 0-based position of the card in the pile where 0 is the bottom of the pile
      Returns:
      the specified card
      Throws:
      NoCardsException - if the pile is empty
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the specified position is negative or greater than or equal to the number of cards in the pile

    • removeTopCard

      public CardBase removeTopCard() throws NoCardsException
      Remove the top card from the pile

      Note: there is no corresponding convenience method to remove the bottom card since that's usually cheating and we can't condone that 8~)

      Returns:
      the top card
      Throws:
      NoCardsException - if the pile is empty

    • prepareCardToAdd

      private void prepareCardToAdd(CardBase newCard)
      prepare a card to be added to this pile:
      • must be provided (non-null)
      • must have an acceptable persistence
      • adjust orientation if necessary
      Parameters:
      newCard - the card to be added
      Since:
